body_html:
Yes, and guided by the evaluation values. If, for a binary classification task, the evaluation drops to "random" after a loss explosion, (eval(k) = 0.50) and i can ensure that before this happened, everything was okay (eval(k-1) = 0.99), then i reroll to model (k-1)

Edit : Practically, it's more like (k-x), because i only save the model so often ;)

Edit : Practically, it's more like (k-x), because i only save the model so often ;)
body:
Yes, and guided by the evaluation values. If, for a binary classification task, the evaluation drops to "random" after a loss explosion, (eval(k) = 0.50) and i can ensure that before this happened, everything was okay (eval(k-1) = 0.99), then i reroll to model (k-1)

Edit : Practically, it's more like (k-x), because i only save the model so often ;)
